action plan.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
CCI Rule 400.4113 Employee records
(1) An institution shall maintain employee records
for each employee and shall include
documentation of all of the following information
prior to employment or at the time specified in
this rule:

(e) Three dated references which are obtained
prior to employment from persons unrelated to
the employee and which are less than 12
m onths old.
One of twelve new employee files reviewed did not have three dated references
completed within 12 months prior to hire. The employee was hired 2/22/24 and
her references were dated 9/16/22.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
Interim Inspection Report dated 3/5/24; CAP approved 4/5/24

(1) An institution shall maintain employee records

CCI Rule 400.4167 Case record maintenance
(1) The institution shall maintain a case record for
each resident.
One of three open youth files reviewed did not have an adequately maintained
case record. The facility created a new file for the youth when they switched from
UC to URM status. The facility made the start date of the youth's first service plan
under their URM file the date when the youth's URM status began, rather than a
consecutive date from the youth's most recent service plan. This practice resulted
in a service plan not being completed every 90 days as required. This is the
facility's practice for all youth who switch from UC to URM status. This issue was
also addressed in the facility's 2024 Interim report.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
Interim Inspection Report dated 3/5/24; CAP approved 4/5/24
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• If the facility is going to continue using the MDHHS-69 Action Summary as the
discharge report when youth are discharged from the program, the facility must
check the box for "Foster Care Case Closure" and must complete all case
closure narrative sections on the form to be in compliance with Rule 166.
• If a youth has an unplanned discharge from the facility, the information written on
the "discharge notification" report sent to ORR must be the same information
listed on the MDHHS-69 Action Summary discharge report.
• The facility should develop a process for youth who switch from UC to URM
status and remain at the facility. Although the facility recognizes a youth's change
in status as two different cases, licensing does not. If the youth does not leave
the facility and live elsewhere, the youth is not considered discharged, and
therefore the youth's case file, and service plan report dates, should be
continuous.

• Staff who write case management reports for youth at the facility must be listed
on the staff list provided to DCWL during annual licensing audits.
• Job references cannot be completed by a staff's "spouse/esposo" as they are
considered a relative.
• The facility should develop a process to ensure discharge plans are being
completed for discharged youth. This should include a process for providing a
summary on unplanned discharges.
• The facility has stated more than once the reasons for some of these non-
compliances are because they are meeting ORR requirements, but not
considering licensing requirements. To maintain licensing for this facility under
the State of Michigan, licensing rules must be followed regardless of any
contractor requirements.
• The facility's new hire orientation requirements must be clearly documented and
consistent. Four different new hire curriculums were found on new employee's
training transcripts. It is imperative new employees are provided with uniform
orientation requirements to ensure consistency for youth and staff.
• If the "new hire curriculum" listed on a new employee's training transcript
includes the 16 hours of required orientation as referenced in Rule 128,
supervisors must ensure new hire curriculum is in "completed" status and not "in
progress" status on staff training transcripts prior to the staff having contact with
youth.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Section one of the CWL-4607-CCI Chief Administrator Report should include a
detailed review and assessment of the institution's compliance with licensing
rules, rather than a list of the violations found during the last annual audit.

Financial Overview
After a review of the facility's budget and financial audit, there were no financial
concerns noted.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not applicable.
Chief Administrator Assessment
Chief Administrator (CA) reports staffing changes have negatively impacted the
facility's compliance with licensing rules. CA reported the quarterly meetings held
with supervisors to review CAP compliance are in place and are working. CA
reported she and the hiring supervisor have been consistently using the new hire
coversheet and staff who transfer programs coversheet to ensure compliance for
employee records, and they feel these checklists have had a positive impact on
compliance.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Employees reported they are short-staffed currently, which is a struggle, but they
are managing. Employees reported everything is going well. Employees reported
they feel supported, and the new home supervisor is very nice. Employees
reported communication between the treatment team and youth specialists is
excellent.
Youth reported they feel safe at the facility. Youth reported things are going well at
the facility, they like living there, and they didn't have any concerns. Youth
reported staff are supportive, and they feel they each have staff they can talk to if
they have any problems or need additional support. Youth reported the food is
good and they get enough food.
Description of Agency Walk Through
A walkthrough of the facility was completed on 1/13/25 and there were no
concerns noted.

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
